main event: A UFO sighting occurred in the Lake Washington Area, Seattle, Washington on 30 January 1956, involving a bluish white, amber orange, and red colored object.
interesting points: The object was first sighted moving from the southwest to the south at 11:45 azimuth,The object was initially considered by the witness to be a star, specifically the star Sirius,The object was sighted each night for four consecutive nights,The investigating officer concluded that it was a star due to the position and visibility during the observation period,There was mention of a possible temperature inversion affecting visibility in the area.
sighted object: one object exhibiting bluish white, amber orange and red colors
witness description: A group consisting of Boy Scouts, the entire troop, and a building custodian witnessed the event.
